qas.question: What is the most common reason people go to the doctor in first world countries?
How can pain effect a person's quality of life and general functioning?
Excitement and distraction are what type of factors which affect pain's intensity?
What has pain sometimes been used as an argument to allow terminally ill patients the right to do?
What is a developed symptom in most medical conditions?
What are social suggestion, hypnotic excitement and distraction?
What has been used in argument for patient-assisted suicide?
What is the most common reason for physician euthanasia?

context: <a0_0><b4_0><b7_0>Pain<b7_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> is the most common reason for physician consultation in most developed countries. It is a major symptom in many medical conditions, and can <a1_0>interfere<a1_0/> with a person's quality of life and general functioning. <a2_0><b5_0>Psychological<a2_0/> factors<b5_0/> such as social support, hypnotic suggestion, excitement, or distraction can significantly affect pain's intensity or unpleasantness. In some arguments put forth in physician-assisted suicide or euthanasia debates, <b6_0>pain<b6_0/> has been used as an argument to permit terminally ill patients to <a3_0>end their lives<a3_0/>.
